1.t: I do not (need to) swear by this town (Mecca)

2.t: in which you are now living

3.t: or by the great father and his wonderful son (Abraham and Ishmael)

4.t: that We have created the human being to face a great deal of hardship.

5.t: Does He think that no one will ever have control over him?

6.t: (He boasts and shows off) saying, "I have spent a great deal of money (for the cause of God)".

7.t: Does he think that no one has seen him?

8.t: Have We not given him two eyes,

10.t: Have We not shown him the ways of good and evil?

11.t: Yet, he has not entered into Aqaba

12.t: Would that you knew what Aqaba is!

13.t: It is the setting free of a slave

14.t: or, in a day of famine, the feeding of
14.tr: Aw it'aamun fee yawmin zee masghabah

16.t: and downtrodden destitute person, (so that he would be of)

17.t: the believers who cooperate with others in patience (steadfastness) and kindness.
17.tr: Summa kaana minal lazeena aamanoo Wa-tawaasaw bissabri Wa-tawaasaw bilmarhamah

18.t: These are the people of the right hand.

19.t: As for those who disbelieve in Our revelations, they are the people of the left
19.tr: Wallazeena kafaroo bi-aayaatinaa hum as-haabul Mash'amah

20.t: who will be engulfed in the fire.
